repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
As outlined in #6227 — we have experienced an issue in production where attempting to write a folly:IOBuf with zero-length backing buffers is triggering a SIGSEGV.

The specific issue actual has to do with how `memoryview` attempts to use scalar assignment instead of slice assignment in the case where the source buffer (in this case, an empty slice) has `len == 0`. By fixing the fork to properly use slice assignment, we avoid the SIGSEGV when we string format the view format (which is NULL).

This PR also adds two additional tests for writing either a single byte or an empty slice to a `memoryview`.

Tested via: `python runtests.py memslice -vv` (which includes the two new tests)

fixes #6227

comment_data.body:
The usual way to spell this is with an identity test, not equality.
```suggestion
            if obj is not None:
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -417,7 +417,7 @@ cdef class memoryview:
 
         if have_slices:
             obj = self.is_slice(value)
-            if obj:
+            if obj != None:

comment_data.body:
We shouldn't be needing this. There's syntax for it.
```suggestion
```

+from cython.view cimport memoryview

 from cython.parallel cimport prange, parallel

+def test_slice_assignment_single_length_slice():
+    """
+    >>> test_slice_assignment_single_length_slice()

+
+    dest_buf: bytearray = bytearray(1)

+    # construct a memory view of the destination buffer

+
+    dest_buf: bytearray = bytearray(1)
+
+    # construct a memory view of the destination buffer
+    view = memoryview(dest_buf, PyBUF_C_CONTIGUOUS)
+

+    print(dest_buf[0])

+    # construct a memory view of the destination buffer
+    view = memoryview(dest_buf, PyBUF_C_CONTIGUOUS)

comment_data.body:
I think `return` is simpler than `print()` here.
```suggestion
    return dest_buf[0]
```

comment_data.body: This performance hint was different from your example (1329 vs. 1325), perhaps due to code staleness?

commit.message: Add unit tests for writing c buffer to memoryview
Fix zero length memoryview assignment segfault by correctly using slice assignment
Apply trivial fixes from code review

commit.message: Fix broken tests via cdef'd helpers
Reploaced test with new test in memoryview.pyx

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
* Remove code for Python 2 and Python < 3.7.
* Integrate better with Python 3.
* Improve support for the Limited API.
* Start supporting GIL-free Python 3.13.
* Support the Py3.13 `sys.monitoring` API.

title: Fix segfault on zero-length slice assignment on memoryview
